newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen facing mild profit-taking at open.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen facing mild profit-taking at open.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to open steady to lower, with the Dow industrials facing mild profit-taking after their recent run-up.
Blue chips are expected to pause for a breather after pushing higher late Tuesday, but analysts do not expect serious selling to develop.

"We may see some profit-taking here," said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments. "But closing above 5700 yesterday was positive from a technical standpoint and I expect the Dow to ultimately wiggle to new highs."

In recent weeks, blue chips have outperformed the market as investors have turned to large-cap top name companies. Analysts said investors were unlikely to shake off their recent aversion to small-cap stocks on a day offering little in the way of economic data and with market participation depressed by the summer doldrums.
"There are no economic numbers of great importance today," said Larry Wachtel, market analyst at Prudential Securities. "The only excitement could be a resurgence of the Dow kind of stocks."
